result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin L Ladewig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $1,000 fine including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges; to be paid from bail on deposit and balance forthwith or court will not allow sentence to be served on ES.

Huber to apply for work.
Courtt ordered sentence to be served on ES.
Court STAYED the commencement until 12-28-15
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gavin L Ladewig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gavin L Ladewig not in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State, Court ordered all exhibits returned to the proferring parties. lr

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court ordered the sentence to be served on ES.  Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15. 

Fine of $1000.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit and balance forthwith or court will not allow sentence to be served on ES. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court denied defense motion for reconsideration.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve. Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense would still like to argue the motion to reconsider that was previously fired.  All other cases will follow along for a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 47.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Motion to Reconsider.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 09-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Suppression motion proceeded. Sworn in for the County : Deputy Daniel Dittberner. Exhibit A , C, D received. State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Cause argued. Court Denied Defense motion to suppress. Court found search proper and is allowed.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47.  Motion hearing scheduled for 08-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Amy Scholz for attorney John Bayer.

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 74. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.
FILED, MOTION TO EXTEND TIME TO FILE PRETRIAL MOTIONS
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription

No dangerous weapons
No firearms

Defendant Gavin L Ladewig in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-055
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.
